intro: Ferula pratovii, commonly known as the alpine ferula, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains volatile oils, which are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are narrow and aromatic, contributing to its distinctive fragrance. Ferula pratovii thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, dry climates.
